intro: Cinchona stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-lipped quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it is notable for its medicinal properties due to the presence of alkaloids, including quinine. Its cultivation has historical significance in the production of antimalarial drugs.
